intro: Castanea buruana, commonly known as the Buru chestnut, is a species of tree native to the island of Buru in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, beeches, and other chestnut species. The plant produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk, similar to other chestnut species. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with a serrated margin. Castanea buruana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
